definition: to leak (of water or gas)/to drip/to drain/to discharge/to leak out/to divulge (secrets)/to give vent (to anger, spite etc)/to disperse/to reduce
surname Mi/name of an ancient state

sentences.english: The Vice President orders them to find the leak.
sentences.chinese: 副总统命令他们找出这个泄密的人。

sentences.english: Another major story was the activities of the WikiLeaks website.
sentences.chinese: 另一重大新闻是维基解密网的泄密活动。

sentences.english: Alternately, new international agreements will surface that attempt curb leaking and punish leakers.
sentences.chinese: 旨在控制泄密和惩罚泄密者的新国际协议也会出现。

sentences.english: Alternately, new international agreements will surface that attempt curb leaking and punish leakers.
sentences.chinese: 旨在控制泄密和惩罚泄密者的新国际协议也会出现。

sentences.english: Winning bidder must sign a non-disclosure, all source will be our property.
sentences.chinese: 中标人必须签订一份不泄密，所有源将是我们的财产。

sentences.english: Yeh was also found guilty of leaking secrets to a lawmaker in a separate case.
sentences.chinese: 叶盛茂也在另一件案子里泄密给一位立委，判决有罪。

sentences.english: "Potential whistleblowers may judge that the risks of revealing classified information are too high, " said Steven Aftergood of the Federation of American Scientists.
sentences.chinese: 潜在的泄密者可能会觉得泄露秘密信息的代价太高了。

sentences.english: The documents were revealed by the whistle- blowing organization Wikileaks.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件由泄密网站维基揭秘披露。

sentences.english: Some have accused Mr Rudd of being the leaker, but he has denied being the source.
sentences.chinese: 有人指责陆克文先生的泄密者，但他否认自己的来源。

sentences.english: "Potential whistleblowers may judge that the risks of revealing classified information are too high," said Steven Aftergood of the Federation of American Scientists.
sentences.chinese: 潜在的泄密者可能会觉得泄露秘密信息的代价太高了。

sentences.english: The talk is of “betrayal” by the government in Islamabad.
sentences.chinese: 在伊斯兰堡的会谈是关于政府的“泄密”。

sentences.english: The examiner has given away the answer.
sentences.chinese: 考试者已经泄密答案了。

sentences.english: Anyone want to take a guess how long it will be before the US government blocks WikiLeaks?
sentences.chinese: 谁可以猜测美国政府会在多久之后封掉维基泄密？

sentences.english: When you spill the beans, you tell a secret.
sentences.chinese: 你说漏嘴时，也就意味着你在泄密。

sentences.english: The US authorities are concentrating their firepower on leakers and their friends.
sentences.chinese: 美国当局集中火力攻击泄密者及其盟友。

sentences.english: A number of governments block access to any address with WikiLeaks in the name.
sentences.chinese: 大量的党政集团以维基泄密网的名义进行地址的链接。

definition: to leak (of information, liquid etc)/to divulge
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
